intro: Bossiaea vombata, commonly known as the Red Stickleback, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Bossiaea vombata is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
